title: Overnight Weekend Technician Attendant
company: West Hills Animal Hospital & Emergency Center
description:
### **Description**

  

Join our amazing team as our newest Veterinary Assistant.  

  

Our focus is on being a place of comfort for our clients and pets, in sickness and in health. You will have an open door for growth opportunities ranging from becoming a veterinary technician, specialty medicine, and future management positions!  

  

This practice is a 24 hour location with a lot going on throughout the day as well as the night. Not only will you build relationships with the animals, but also be able to build relationships with our clients.  

Key Requirements: Able to work and multitask in a fast-paced environment Be comfortable with handling animals of all species' and sizes Knowledge of different animal medications Build relationships with clients and peers Have good computer skills  

  

\\*\\*We are looking for weekend and/or overnight availability\\*\\*### **Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:**

  

* Caring for special needs borders such as diabetics, geriatrics, epileptics, etc.
* Restraining a variety of canine, feline, and exotic species for the doctors and technicians
* Cleaning (Sweeping, Mopping, cages, dishes, garbage, surgical site, dental Suite, etc.)
* Administering oral medications
* Documentation of general well-being of in-hospital patients and boarders
* Assisting with Er protocol, ensuring ER table is prepared for crashing patients
* Preparing surgical material in coordination with the surgical handbook (ensure materials are sterilized and prepared for procedures)
* Assisting LVTs with TPRs & blood pressures. examining incisions for cleanliness and closure
* Triaging emergency appointments in coordination with the ER doctor on-premises.
* Capturing various types of radiographs including but not limited to the thorax and abdominal views

  

### **Skills Knowledge and Expertise**

  

* High school diploma or GED required
* Preferred have at least 1 year of veterinary medicine experience
* Must be a bright, friendly, and effective communicator in order to communicate with clients, visitors, veterinarians, and other hospital staff. (It’s okay if you talk to animals, too!)
* Must be able to sit, stand, walk, and move freely for extended periods of time
* Must be able to lift 50 squirming pounds
* Must be able to work in a veterinary environment with exposure to infection or contagious diseases

  

### **Benefits**

  

* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision insurance
* Employee discounts
* Flexible schedules
* 401K with company match
* Career development and training

  

### **About West Hills Animal Hospital & Emergency Center**


West Hills Animal Hospital & Emergency Center, in Huntington, NY, is a 24-hour full-service animal and pet emergency center providing veterinary wellness care, general veterinary medical care, pet emergency, and critical care, and pet specialty care including cardiology, clinical pathology, dentistry, HD CT Imaging, integrative medicine, internal medicine, oncology, rehabilitation, reproduction, and surgery. From annual wellness exams and vaccinations to surgical and diagnostic care, we treat pets with the best personalized veterinary medical care at our state-of-the-art veterinary medical facility.  

  

West Hills Animal Hospital & Emergency Center is an exceptional and supportive environment in which to practice excellent medicine, grow professionally, and work alongside great colleagues. We are passionate about pets and have 6 locations staffed with experienced veterinarians, technicians, specialists, and rehabilitation professionals. We are a part of the West Hills Animal Hospital family of practices, including:* Locust Valley Veterinary Clinic
* Oyster Bay Animal Hospital
* Gold Coast Center for Veterinary Care
* Court Square Animal Hospital

title: After School Enrichment Teacher
description:
NY Kids Club & NY Preschool is inspiring today’s children to succeed in tomorrow’s world with our love for play— and we’re looking for an Afternoon Club Teacher to join our growing team!

Our mission is to instill a lifelong love of learning with our engaging curriculum, taught in a safe, dynamic and supportive environment and designed to enrich every child throughout their educational journey.

We pride ourselves on an environment that allows you to find a sense of belonging, learn from your diverse teammates, who have a great sense of humor, and take pride in everything they do; if that sounds like you, join us!

**Here’s what an Afternoon Club Teacher's day looks like:**

* Safety is our number one pillar! Ensure each student's health and safety at all times through adherence to our daily protocols
* Teach an exciting array of enrichment based classes for children ages 2-6 years. These age-appropriate programs range from sports, dance, STEAM, and more!
* Bring our unique, creative and original curriculum to life while meeting the needs of each student
* Support each student in their social, emotional, cognitive, and physical growth by learning through play in a positive and caring way
* Engage daily with parents and caregivers, sharing your classroom’s day-to-day activities

*The statements in this job description are intended to describe the essential nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be all responsibilities or qualifications of the job.*

**This job is for you if:**

* Have a High School Diploma or GED
* Hold 1-2 years of experience teaching children ages 2-6 years
* Have experience leading specialty enrichment classes, camp, or children's events
* Have passion for creating magical classroom memories that last a lifetime
* Are well-spoken and comfortable speaking with parents and caregivers
* Are a lifelong learner!
* Must have availability either 12pm-6pm or 2pm-6pm

**What’s in it for you:**

* Dental and Vision Benefits
* Paid Time Off
* 401(k) Savings and Retirement Plan
* Tuition Assistance
* Commuter Program
* Discounted Fitness membership

*The pay rate for this role is $20.00/hour with the potential to grow to $22.00/hour*

**Physical Demands:**

The role involves standing, walking, sitting, constant movement, and occasional climbing. The ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds is required. Specific sensory abilities include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and adjustment of focus.

**Inclusivity and Diversity:**

NY Kids Club & NY Preschool is committed to an inclusive and diverse community. We celebrate differences, leading with kindness and respect. We are an equal opportunity employer, prohibiting discrimination based on various factors.

**Accommodations:**

The NY Kids Club complies with ADA requirements. If you need accommodation in completing the application, please contact interview@nykidsclub.com.

title: Manager In Training / Fitness Sales Consultant
description:
**Who Are We?**  
LA Fitness is a privately owned fitness club chain. LA Fitness has hundreds of health clubs and millions of members across US and Canada. In an industry often equated with fad and fashion, LA Fitness has steadily increased its presence by focusing on the one lifelong benefit valued by everyone: good health.

**About Us**  
Founded in Southern California in 1984, LA Fitness continues to seek innovative ways to enhance the physical and emotional well-being of our increasingly diverse membership base. With our wide range of amenities and highly trained staff, we provide fun and effective workout options to family members of all ages and interests.

**Position:**  
Sales Counselor (SC) Do you have a passion for helping people with their health and wellness goals? Can you use those passions to influence others to make positive changes to their lifestyle? We are looking to bring high energy and positive individuals with a background in fitness to join our team as Personal Training Counselors!

We are actively recruiting candidates to take part in our rapidly growing NY Market. In search of Sales representatives with the aspirations to grow into future Fitness Director or General Managers roles due to our explosive growth. Candidates must be Passionate for Fitness, Sales, Marketing, Self-Motivated and Disciplined, Well Organized, and Looking for Career Advancement. Here at LA FITNESS, we are looking for candidates that represent H.E.A.T.; Honest - Enthusiastic - Achievement Oriented - Team Players.

**Job Description**

**The Top 4 Duties of a SC are to act as a:** 

* Personal Performance - meet/exceed company standards with personal commissions and VCLASS production
* Personal Sales Process - show full competency in sales process knowledge. • Personal Customer Service - show ability to always be on time, in uniform, and positively enthusiastic with members, guests, and coworkers.
* Personal Systems - manage your daily planner, guest register, callback list, and success report at company standards. What We Expect from You
* To consistently demonstrate a positive attitude and a strong work ethic we will teach you the skills necessary to build a distinguished career, but you must provide the proper foundation.
* Write good personal commissions consistently
* Achieve company VCLASS standards consistently, VIPs (4) per sale - Calls (60) per day - Leads (20) per day - Appts (6) 1st time per day - Show (3) per day - Sales (3) per day.
* Show competency with rates, commissions, SMT, digital price presentation, F.A. Questions.
* Provide awareness within the local community of what LA Fitness has to offer as well as the ability to create a sense of urgency in becoming a part of our member base.
* Generate personal contacts, business contacts along with daily appointments to tour our facility from your marketing efforts.
* Knowledge within community events ensuring club participation and are actively involved.
* Exceptional external marketing and relationship building through our community outreach program.
* Ability to excel in an environment that sets goals, tracks progress, and strives for growth.
* Ability to effectively communicate expectations to staff and create a winning culture.
* Possess excellent time management, organizational and follow-up skills.
* Must be enthusiastic, energetic, personable, and friendly as well as passionate.
* Previous sales experience required
* To always act with integrity and confidence that what we offer is worth far more than what we ask for it.

**What You Can Expect From Us**

* To be able to advance as high as your performance takes you. The sky is the limit for those who excel.
* To be able to steadily increase your income each month through Downline Bonuses as your client base grows.
* To learn Sales skills, Life skills, Negotiating skills, Time management skills, Leadership skills, People skills and Problem-solving skills.
* An opportunity for an ever-changing career, filled with challenge, opportunity, variety, and satisfaction. Keys to Success / Advancement
* Uphold and support LA Fitness policies positively and enthusiastically.
* Consistently maintain strong personal commissions & VCLASS production.
* Line up personally each day as well or better than your best team member. Demonstrate the daily discipline necessary to consistently excel.
* Train all day, every day. We can all use daily reminders and guidance.
* Take full ownership of your own success.
* Exude confidence, and you'll inspire confidence. Dream big. You will never be better than what you can imagine.
* Have an enthusiastic work ethic. success only comes before work in the dictionary. • Remember, the world is full of talented failures. discipline is what creates superstars.

**Benefits** 

* Commission
* Bonus incentives
* Medical insurance after 90 days
* Growth opportunities
* Complimentary membership
* Full-time position: this position requires 40 hours worked each week.
* Evening and weekend hours are required

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

Work Location: In person

title: Inside Sales Associate--- Customer Service/Sales phone exp preferred
description:
**INSIDE SALES REPRESENTATIVE**

**Company Overview:**

We are a reputable debt restructuring company specializing in providing financial solutions and relief to small businesses facing challenging economic circumstances. Our mission is to empower small businesses by offering customized debt restructuring services that enable them to regain financial stability and sustain long-term growth. We are seeking a motivated and results-driven Inside Sales Representative to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in reaching out to potential clients through cold calling.

**Job Summary:**

As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be an integral part of our sales team, responsible for prospecting, reaching out, and building relationships with small business owners seeking debt restructuring solutions. Your primary focus will be cold calling potential clients, identifying their financial challenges, and introducing our tailored debt restructuring services. The successful candidate will be a persuasive communicator, adept at handling objections, and passionate about helping small businesses thrive despite financial difficulties.

**Responsibilities**:

· Conduct outbound calls to prospective customers to introduce our products/services and generate sales leads.

· Qualify leads and identify potential customers' needs and requirements.

· Present and demonstrate our products/services to potential clients through phone calls, emails, and virtual meetings.

· Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, providing exceptional customer service and addressing any inquiries or concerns.

· Collaborate with the sales team to develop and implement effective sales strategies and tactics.

· Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets and objectives.

· Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of sales activities and customer interactions in the CRM system.

· Stay informed about industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities to identify new business opportunities.

· Continuously enhance product knowledge and sales skills through training and professional development opportunities.

**Requirements**:

· Proven experience in inside sales or a similar sales role, preferably in a B2B environment.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish trust with customers.

· Strong negotiation and persuasion abilities.

· Self-motivated and target-oriented, with a drive to achieve and exceed sales goals.

We offer a base salary and commission!

We offer training!

We offer a fast-paced and team-oriented environment!

Check out our website: www.nuvisionresolve.com

title: Corporate Controller - Healthcare Experience
description:
Must have healthcare sector experience

Responsibilities of this position are to administer, direct and monitor all financial activities and keep the CEO and respective Governing Body members informed of the financial condition of the companies. Produce timely and accurate financial reporting. Assist management in decision-making via financial reports and implications. Identify financial risks and opportunities. Ability to think both big picture/strategically and “in the weeds.”

***Responsibilities for the Accounting and Human Resource Teams as a singular Unit***

Supervisory responsibility for accounting/bookkeeping staff and the Human Resources Manager

ü Recruit staff with appropriate skill levels to accomplish goals and objectives

ü Build a highly effective and innovative team as evidenced by successful operational and strategic performance, appropriate risk-taking, innovation, and success in responding to changes in the business environment

ü Structure the team to best achieve the goals and objectives of the finance department, including attention to internal equities (workload) and cost efficiencies

ü Enforce the personnel policies of the organization

ü Conduct annual personnel reviews of all staff directly reporting to the position

***Operational Responsibilities***

ü Provide proactive, sound guidance regarding management of assets and financial trends within the facilities

ü Employee a system of responsible accounting, including budgeting and internal controls while assuring effective revenue cycle and expense reporting processes

ü Develop and implement systems that match the needs of the organization and re structured to maximize internal controls and the safeguarding of assets

ü Develop and maintain accounting processes as well as policies and procedures. Maintain the integrity of all financial systems

ü Ensures that the CEO is aware of all key financial development

ü Present monthly and quarterly financial statements internally and at Governing Body meetings – responsible for the preparation, content, integrity and presentation of data

ü Correspondent and coordinator with external entities – bankers, external auditors, lawyers, computer consultants, insurance companies, etc.

ü Attend and actively participate in Governing Body and company level meetings

ü Check signing responsibilities

***Education and Experience***

ü Bachelor’s degree with an accounting major

ü CPA preferred

ü Five plus years of experience in a healthcare organization and an accounting related position. Dialysis industry experience preferred.

title: Hotel Maintenance Technician
description:
The Sanctuary Hotel is looking for a Maintenance Technician to join our four-star, luxury lifestyle hotel with 5-star service in the heart of Times Square. Our company strives to make every guests experience unique to their personal needs. The Maintenance Technician is also required to maintain a pleasant and sophisticated appearance at all times. A background in a hotel or facility maintenance is required.

We are looking for a thorough Maintenance Technician to undertake the responsibility to preserve the good condition and functionality of premises. You will perform maintenance tasks of great variety such as painting, HVAC installations, basic plumbing and electrical repairs, etc. A Maintenance Technician is a thorough professional with a practical mind and attention to detail. The ideal candidate will be able to work autonomously and responsibly by observing all health and safety guidelines. The goal is to maintain the buildings and common areas in the best possible condition.

**Responsibilities**

* Survey buildings and repair mechanical systems to ensure they are consistent with health and safety standards
* Perform maintenance of electrical systems (replace light bulbs and sockets, clean and repair circuit breaker panels etc.)
* Assist in the setup of ventilation, refrigeration and other systems and conduct repairs when necessary
* Maintain heating and plumbing systems to ensure functionality
* Perform manual repairs when necessary (fix locks, replace windows etc.)
* Conduct general upkeep procedures and other tasks as assigned (painting, carpentry etc.)

**Skills**

* Proven experience as maintenance technician
* Basic understanding of electrical, hydraulic and other systems
* Knowledge of general maintenance processes and methods
* Working knowledge of tools, common appliances and devices
* Manual dexterity and problem-solving skills
* Good physical condition and strength with a willingness to work overtime
* High school diploma or equivalent; Certificate in HVAC, building maintenance technology or relevant field will be a plus
* FDNY FLSD preferred but not required

title: Director, Tech Lead - Data Protection
description:
Job Classification:
Technology - Engineering & Cloud
Are you interested in building capabilities that enable the organization with innovation, speed, agility, scalability and efficiency? The Global Technology team takes great pride in our culture where digital transformation is built into our DNA! When you join our organization at Prudential, you’ll unlock an exciting and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions.  

  

Your Team  

As a Director, Tech Lead on Security Service Data Protection team, you will partner with product owners, designers, engineers and delivery professionals to improve Prudential’s capabilities around). You will provide guidance on technical strategy, design the overall technology architecture and mentor and coach the technical team as you implement capabilities to solve sophisticated business problems, deploy innovative products, services and experiences to delight our customers! In addition to deep technical expertise and experience, you will bring excellent problem solving, communication and teamwork skills, along with agile ways of working, strong business insight, an inclusive leadership attitude and a continuous learning focus to all that you do.* Drive the Data Protection vision, designing the overall technological architecture of Cyber Defense Visibility and Automation solutions [User and Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA), Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), investigating the use of GEN AI to assist Cyber Defenders, and Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR)] with support of the team
* Responsible for technical design and infrastructure / environments strategy, including deployments, ensuring that these are kept in-line with a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) mentality of ‘emerging architecture’
* Collaborate with product owners in aligning the roadmap accounting for strengths and opportunities within the technical stack, bringing forward business acuity and knowledge to influence decisions
* Guide Agile teams on technology strategy related to coding practices, continuous integration, and automated deployment, as a leader and doer helping to interpret technology strategy into consumable units of work
* Mentor and coach the technical team on results and timelines, including support with design reviews, domain knowledge and ownership as well as bring a deep understanding of relevant and emerging technologies, embedding learning and innovation in the day-to-day
* Identify and remove complex technical impediments that may arise within the team
* Help the Agile team to develop solutions and solve all surfacing problems at hand, constantly look for innovative ways of solving technical problems and crafting the solution, not afraid of challenging the status quo
* Serve as a technical liaison with adjacent areas to integrate applications and implement Network Security engineering best practices for increased security posture quality

  

The Skills & Expertise You Bring  

* Bachelor of Computer Science or Engineering or experience in related fields
* Lead and effectively leverage diverse ideas, experiences, thoughts and perspectives to the benefit of the organization
* Experience with agile development methodologies and Test-Driven Development (TDD)
* Knowledge of business concepts tools and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business
* Ability to learn new skills and knowledge on an on-going basis through self-initiative and tackling challenges
* Strong executive presence with an ability to translate and communicate sophisticated technical solutions in understandable terms to a broad range of audiences
* Excellent problem solving and collaboration skills
* Significant experience and/or deep expertise with several of the following:


o UEBA  

o SOAR  

o SIEM  

o Understanding of Gen AI technologies in reference to Cyber Defense  

* Preferred qualifications:


o DLP Experience  

o XDR Experience  

o CASB Experience  

o Service Now Experience  

o Financial/Insurance industry experience is a plus, not a must  

  

You’ll Love Working Here Because You Can  

Join a team and culture where your voice matters; where every day, your work transforms our experiences to make lives better. As you put your skills to use, we’ll help you make an even bigger impact with learning experiences that can grow your technical AND leadership capabilities. You’ll be surprised by what this rock-solid organization has in store for you.
What we offer you:* Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave
* Retirement plans:
* 401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%)
* Company-funded pension plan
* Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
* Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.
* Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment toward obtaining an approved degree, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Shares can be purchased at 85% of the lower of two prices (Beginning or End of the purchase period), after one year of service.


To find out more about our Total Reward package, visit Work Life Balance | Prudential Careers. Some of the above benefits may not apply to part-time employees scheduled to work less than 20 hours per week.
Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $173,500.00 to $234,700.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. In addition, employees are eligible for standard benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and retirement.
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.

title: Corporate Governance Associate
description:
States considered:
Role Description
The Corporate Governance Associate will provide project management and paralegal support within Corporate Governance, assisting the Director, Corporate Governance on a variety of responsibilities related to subsidiary governance for Zoetis’ global network of entities and provide support with respect to various additional operational matters within the Zoetis Legal Function.  

Position Responsibilities:* Work with the broader Corporate Governance team to advance our subsidiary management and legal entity management and governance strategy, including preparing corporate legal documents, powers of attorneys, local filings and registrations, and coordinating across internal team members and third-party service providers.
* Support special Legal function and subsidiary governance projects from time to time (including corporate reorganizations, integrations and entity formations and eliminations).
* Support the tracking of international legal entity changes and maintenance of the global subsidiary entity database, including the repository of corporate documents, and on-going preparation of required compliance materials (i.e., KYC and UBO requests, director and officer lists, entity structure charts, addresses and other corporate details).
* Contribute to project management and organization related to compliance with global sustainability obligations.


Education and Experience:* Associate’s degree required; Bachelor’s degree preferred.
* Certificate in Paralegal Studies preferred.
* 3-5 years of relevant experience preferred in company or law firm setting.


Technical Skills:* Must demonstrate a strong attention to detail with excellent organizational, communication, analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience in project management and ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and work independently.
* Highly professional and diplomatic.
* Ability to work professionally with senior management.
* Strong computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Suite applications and ability and willingness to learn other Zoetis software applications as required.


Physical Requirements:* Hybrid working environment, with approximately 50% of time (2-3 work days per week) required on-site in Parsippany, NJ headquarters office.

title: Music Teacher
description:
**About The School of Rock Waldwick**  
School of Rock Waldwick is a performance-based music school on a mission to inspire kids to rock onstage, and in life! School of Rock is the original performance-based, interactive music school. The Waldwick school has been in business since 2010. We have a great community of teachers, students, and supportive families. Our students are in bands that we organize. This motivates them to learn and practice between lessons and rehearsals. School of Rock with over 379 schools in 19 different countries is a strong, internationally recognized brand, the Company is the largest after school music education provider. School of Rock is a growing, passionate community dedicated to enriching lives through performance-based music education. If you are passionate about music education and have the skills necessary to inspire others, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team as a Music Teacher!

**Our Work Environment Includes:**

A variety of tools to enhance teaching experience and help students learn effectively.

· iPads, computer monitors, and connecting cables for seamless integration of technology into lessons.

· Guitars, Basses, Piano/electric keyboards, Drum sets, and Microphones

· PA systems and guitar/bass amplifiers

· Professional music venue

· Mobile tools for lesson scheduling

· Patented App for learning music exclusive to School of Rock.

· The patented School of Rock Method is different than traditional music school. We combine one-on-one instruction with group rehearsals and live performances, teaching students how to play together as a band. Our version of recitals are real rock shows at real venues in front of live audiences. Each year, School of Rock puts on a bunch of rock shows as part of our curriculum.

**Music Teacher** **Summary**

Our Music teachers are the focal point of the School of Rock. Our teachers are professional musicians who want to share their love of rock and roll with the next generation. We are looking for musicians to teach the following: Vocals, Guitar, Bass, Drums, and Piano. We are also looking for musicians to be show directors for our bands.

**Music Teacher** **Schedule (Part Time)**

Schedules are built between the times listed below. New teachers start with a few hours on a few days based on their availability. Then their scheduled can grow into a total of 36 hours if they are available and want the hours. Below are the hours we offer lessons.

· Monday to Thursday 3pm to 9pm

· Friday 3pm to 7:30pm

· Saturdays 10 to 3

· Occasional Saturdays for shows or special events

· Summer Camp opportunities available

**Music Teacher** **Benefits**

· Competitive salary

· Additional cash bonuses, given monthly.

· Paid professional training on School of Rock’s methods and tools.

· Social Security, Unemployment, and Medicare

· Direct Deposit

· Employee discounts of new gear

· Access to SoR Method™ tools

· Fun environment, great community

**Music Teacher** **Skills**

· 4 + years’ experience teaching preferred.

· Professional performing experience

· Knowledge of music theory

· Knowledge of rock music

· Ability to read music & write charts

· Multi-instrumentalists a bonus

**Music Teacher** **Requirements:**

· Ability to deal with a wide age range and abilities of students.

· Strong organizational skills

· Ability to follow the School of Rock curriculum.

· Enthusiastic, patient, and positive demeanor

· Computer skills needed.

· Lives in Northern NJ (can easily commute to Waldwick, NJ)

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 6 – 36 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid training
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* After school
* Choose your own hours

Application Question(s):

* What age groups are you comfortable teaching? (8yo - 12yo), (13yo- 17yo) (18yo – adult)
* What instruments are you qualified to teach? (guitar, singing, piano, bass)

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Waldwick, NJ 07463 (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: We are a growing passionate music school with 6000 sq feet of Rock and Roll fun! We have a full professional music venue. We use innovative tools & our own method books to make teaching fun & easy.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
**Overview:**  
Takara Belmont USA is looking for a **Marketing Coordinator** with strong digital marketing and project coordination experience to bring onto the team! If you enjoy content creation, have a passion for social media, and are a pro at building online communities, then we want you to apply.

In this role, you will contribute to integrated communications campaigns, including research, planning, execution, and reporting. This candidate is the primary point of contact for our beauty and dental brands. A successful candidate thrives in an ever-changing, fast-paced environment with a wide range of creative opportunities. The position is ideal for enthusiastic problem solvers with an ability to convert complex challenges into simple solutions.

**Responsibilities:**  
1. Collaborate across business units on multi-platform strategies, tactics, and outcomes.

2. Work closely with internal Sales and Marketing leads to develop and implement social strategies and campaigns, ensuring alignment with broader marketing priorities, business goals, voice, and brand.

3. Develop and maintain a strong working relationship with external vendors, agencies, and consultants.

4. Optimize existing social media management resources for publishing, reporting, advertising, listening, and day-to-day upkeep and maintenance.

5. Map customer journeys across full funnel digital activations (website, media, social, e-commerce, etc.).

6. Achieve social media marketing KPIs and develop timely reports to identify key takeaways, actionable opportunities, and other insights.

7. Collaborate with marketing and branding team to promote efficiencies and amplify individual strengths.

8. Communicate and stay informed of industry news, digital trends, and emerging technologies.

9. Champion all social media efforts to develop compelling content for daily posting schedules.

10. Monitor, respond, and/or funnel in-bound inquiries to the sales regions and other departments.

11. Copywrite and edit for all channels and assets using a clear and consistent voice that accurately represents our brands and builds trust within each community.

12. Curate sales spotlights and customer success stories for social media accounts and brand websites.

13. Cultivate customer-generated content pipelines, image and video libraries, and content releases.

14. Coordinate video and photo production, editing, and setup with internal stakeholders and vendors.

15. Facilitate KOL and influencer marketing opportunities to increase our brand presence in each industry.

16. Craft messaging, artwork outlines, and creative briefs for print and digital advertising campaigns.

17. Promote and maintain appropriate, positive public relations for our brands.

18. Draft product profiles, press releases, announcements, trade articles, blog posts, and other materials.

19. Coordinate and support the development of trade show marketing materials, including product literature, promotional flyers, price lists, banners, and other sales and marketing peripherals.

20. Maintain our print literature libraries, including the creation, production, and fulfillment processes.

21. Manage our digital asset libraries to support requests from internal team, strategic partners, and customers.

22. All other duties as assigned by management.

**Qualifications:**  
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Public Relations or Communications.

At least 1-3 years of marketing experience. Relevant job experience in lieu of degree will be considered.

**Please submit writing samples when applying for this position.**

**Required:**

Social Media Programming; Content Development; Copywriting & Editing; Messaging & Media Planning; Product Decks; Task Management; Collaboration & Coordination; Print & Digital Advertising (Basic); Adobe Creative Suite (Basic); Basic WordPress (Basic)

**Preferred:** 

Branding & Creative Strategy; Web Content; E-mail Marketing; Google Analytics; Facebook Business Suite; Hootsuite or Agorapulse; Photo & Video Planning; Event Planning; Tradeshow Support; Microsoft Office 365; Adobe Creative Suite (Advanced); SEO/SEM & PPC Advertising (Advanced)

**Desired:**

B2B Marketing; E-commerce Channel Management; Digital Asset Management Systems; Competitive Analysis; Market Research; Digital Analytics & Reporting; Photography; Storyboarding; Video Editing & Production; WordPress, HTML, CSS; Ad & Media Campaigns; Salesforce Sales Cloud

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $68,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

description:
Would you like a career in health care with the region’s leading community health center?

Open Door Family Medical Centers has an outstanding opportunity for you as a Dental Assistant **Bilingual English & Spanish** in our site Ossining, NY.

As an Open Door employee, you would be eligible to participate in Open Door's Retention Bonus Plan, which pays a quarterly bonus of $750, beginning the first quarter following 3 months of employment as long as you remain an active employee in good standing. The Retention Bonus Plan will continue until December 2024.

Joining Open Door, you will experience not just a change in jobs but in your quality of life, with challenging and rewarding career options open to you, ongoing training and development, as well as a competitive salary, annual bonus and a comprehensive benefits package.

Want to learn more about this opportunity? Let’s arrange a time to talk by phone. Please contact Nancy Rodriguez via phone: (914) 502-1415. Looking forward to hearing from you.

**COMMUNITY HEALTH CARE VIDEO:** https://www.chcanys.org/remote-video/nursing-staff-within-community-health-centers

**HEALTHCARE CENTER WORKFORCE VIDEO:** https://www.chcanys.org/health-center-resources/chc-operations/workforce

The Dental Assistant performs a variety of patient care, office and laboratory duties. Assisting the dentist, prepare patients for treatment, taking x-rays, scheduling dental appointments.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Provides chair-side assistance when necessary, during dental treatment.
* Assures that dental record, medical record, and encounter form are available for the dentist or dental hygienist.
* Prepares patient for examinations and treatment, including placement of bib and instruments for procedure.
* Maintains supplies and instruments in all dental procedures.
* Performs laboratory and x-ray tasks under supervision of dentist.
* Make appointments for patients. Verifies the need for return appointments.
* Greets visitors and patients in a courteous, prompt, and friendly manner.
* Determines their needs, checks appointments, and gives appropriate information.
* If designated as responsible for Biohazardous Waste removal, complete online training and receive certificate prior to completing this task.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* High School Diploma preferred
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) required
* Superior customer service skills and experience
* Passionate about providing high quality care.
* Minimum 1 Year Dental Assistant Experience
* Maintain patient confidentiality at all times
* Engage in learning and continuous quality improvement
* Outstanding verbal and written communications, with a culturally diverse patient and staff population

title: Sales Specialist
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**Position Responsibilities**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

* Provide a great experience by engaging with guests utilizing your acquired skills and training.
* Assist guests’ selection and recommendation of merchandise and services in accordance with their identified needs.
* Demonstrate a high level of interest in the welfare, health, and proper handling of all animals.
* Process register transactions and create a great experience for each guest.
* Generate future business through a deep understand of the guests and their pet/s and connection to our digital platforms.
* Perform related duties in support of the Pet Care Center attaining its assigned sales goals.
* Ensure merchandise is stocked, priced, and displayed to create a great presentation for our guests.
* Completes and applies training programs to maintain a high level of expertise of their role.
* Adhere to established operational guidelines, policies, and procedures.
* Promote a positive culture of teamwork, inclusion, and collaboration.
* Complete other duties and special projects as assigned.
* Evaluate guest inquiries and as needed refers to the Leader on Duty.

**Other Essential Duties**

* **UTILIZE SELLING BEHAVIORS**. You’re the key to providing an amazing guest experience within our Pet Care Locations. Utilizing the behaviors within our Sales Model is critical to being able to identify and solve for their needs both today and in the future.
* **CONTRIBUTE TO A SAFE ENVIRONMENT**. You’ll be empowered through our training programs to maintain our safety protocols. Bottom line, the safety of partners, guests and pets is our #1 priority.
* **BE A PART OF A COLLABORATIVE CULTURE**. Being a great teammate is key to creating a culture that is centered around solving for the health and wellness needs of pets.
* **ENGAGE IN YOUR CAREER:** As you develop your skills and knowledge, you will have the opportunity to participate in developmental programs to support your continued growth throughout your career.

**Basic Qualifications**


Minimum of one year of sales experience is required for this position. Qualified applicants will possess a high level of knowledge of pet nutrition and an aptitude for sales techniques. In addition to having a professional appearance and demeanor, applicants must also demonstrate a keen and genuine interest in animals and their care. Good interpersonal and verbal communication skills are necessary due to the nature of interaction with the public and other partners and leaders within the store.

**Certification**


Completing and maintaining of the appropriate specialist level of the Petco Certification program is required in this role.

**Preferred Qualifications**


Prior pet nutrition experience and working with and/or caring for pets recommended.

**Supervisory Responsibility**

* None

**Work Environment**


The majority of job duties are conducted indoors, although merchandise receiving, merchandise carry-outs, or stock balancing will require leaving the store briefly. This position requires bending, kneeling, moving merchandise and standing for long periods of time. Must be able to lift 50 lbs and pull 2000 lbs utilizing material handling equipment. Improper use of safety equipment and/or not following proper lifting techniques may pose of risk of injury to customers, pets, and Pet Care Center personnel. Follow all safety precautions and procedures. Must be available for shifts on evenings, weekends and some overnights and holidays.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

These ranges may differ in other areas and could be subject to variation based on regulatory minimum wage requirements. Actual pay rates will depend on factors such as position, location, level of experience, and applicable state or local minimum wage laws. If the regulatory minimum wage exceeds the minimum indicated in the pay range below, the regulatory minimum wage will be the minimum rate applied.*


$17.50 - $26.00

title: Groomer
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**Job Summary:** As a Pet Stylist at Petco, you will be responsible for providing professional grooming services to our valued customers' pets. With your expertise and attention to detail, you will ensure that each pet receives exceptional care, leaving them looking and feeling their best. You will have the opportunity to showcase your grooming skills, creativity, and passion for animals in a dynamic and rewarding environment.

**Your Petco Grooming Career:**

* Competitive base pay, plus incentive
* Medical, dental, vision and more
* 401k and more
* Paid Time Off
* Petco Discounts
* All the supplies & equipment you need, including, clippers, blades, shears, shampoo, sprays, tools, etc.
* State of the art equipment, including bathing system, kennels, tables, and dryers
* Career development and growth opportunities, such as a Grooming Salon Leader, Grooming Mentor and Grooming Instructor

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform grooming services including nail trims, ear cleaning. bathing, brushing, haircuts, and styling, adhering to breed standards and pet owners' preferences.
* Safely and efficiently maintain & operate grooming tools and equipment such as clippers, shears, brushes, and dryers.
* Learn and follow Petco's grooming policies, standards and guidelines to ensure quality and consistency in all areas of the grooming business.
* Monitor pets for any signs of discomfort, illness, or injury, and promptly report any concerns to pet owners and store management.
* Assess and address each pet's individual needs, taking into consideration their coat type, skin condition, and temperament.
* Provide exceptional customer service by actively listening to pet owners' requests, offering grooming recommendations, and addressing any questions or concerns.
* Educate pet owners on grooming maintenance and at home care practices to promote the overall well-being of their pets.
* Collaborate with fellow groomers and store team members to create a positive and supportive work environment.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a professional groomer with a strong portfolio of successful grooming work.
* In-depth knowledge of various dog breeds, their grooming requirements, and common health issues & behaviors.
* Proficiency in breed-specific cuts, styling techniques, and grooming standards.
* Familiarity with grooming tools and equipment, and the ability to handle them safely and effectively.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact confidently and professionally with pet owners and team members.
* Strong attention to detail, ensuring grooming services are executed accurately and to the highest standards.
* Physical stamina to stand for extended periods, lift and handle pets of different sizes, and perform repetitive grooming tasks.
* Compassion and patience when handling pets, ensuring their safety, comfort, and well-being throughout the grooming process.
* Flexibility to work weekends, evenings, and holidays based on the grooming schedule and customer demand.

**Note:** The Pet Stylist position at Petco offers an exciting opportunity to utilize your grooming expertise and passion for animals. Join our dedicated team of professionals, and together we will create a positive grooming experience for pets and their owners while upholding Petco's commitment to excellence in pet care.


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

description:

The ideal Salesperson is passionate about fashion and styling and has the ability to cultivate and grow a customer following, both digitally and in-store.

title: Equity Derivatives Trading, Managing Director
description:
**About Us**
------------


Founded in 1963, William O'Neil Securities (ONS) is a Broker/Dealer providing trading services to institutional clients, including pension funds, mutual funds, hedge funds, insurance companies, and corporations. The firm's mission is to assist its clients in maximizing their performance through its trading expertise and providing the anonymity its clients expect. The firm's trading desk offers expertise on domestically traded companies on the NYSE and NASDAQ exchanges. Headquartered in Boston, MA, the firm has trading desks in San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, and New York. ONS is regulated by the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority.

**Summary**
-----------


Trade execution agent between clients and the equity marketplace.

**Duties and Responsibilities**
-------------------------------

* Executes Equity Derivative orders accurately and timely as presented by clients.
* Communicates effectively and concisely information surrounding a client’s order.
* Reviews execution transactions to ensure accuracy of information and to ensure trades conform to regulatory requirements of governing agencies.
* Develops and implements short and long term sales and trading strategies to achieve revenue growth goals.
* Generate and present Equity Derivative ideas for both external and internal clients.
* Develops and cultivates new client relationships
* Performs other duties as requested by management.
**Qualifications & Requirements**
---------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree or higher in related field or equivalent experience
* Perform all work and activities with honesty and integrity
* Take personal responsibility for productivity, quality and timeliness of work
* Effectively communicate (and listen) clearly, professionally, politely and persuasively in all situations; respond well and in a reasonable, timely manner
* Challenge conventional practices and use creativity and information to lead, innovate, problem solve, and implement ideas to contribute to the growth of the organization
* Support and meet company/department goals and core values
* Collaborate with co-workers to achieve common goals
* Problem Solving/Analysis
* Technical Capacity
* Time Management
**Salary Range**
----------------


This position offers a competitive compensation package, including a base salary of $100,000 and an uncapped variable component.

**Working Conditions**
----------------------


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to type. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work may require some weekend and/or evening work. Work may require some weekend and/or evening work.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
------------------------------


William O'Neil Securities is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Dog Trainer
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**Dog Trainer**

**Position Overview**: Petco is seeking a motivated and enthusiastic individual to join our team as a Dog Trainer. As a Petco Certified Dog Trainer, you will play a vital role in furthering Petco mission as a Pet Health and Wellness company by enhancing the bond between pet parents and their furry companions. Your expertise in modern dog training techniques and positive reinforcement methods will help pet parents develop well-behaved, happy, and healthy dogs. You will provide one-on-one training sessions, group classes, and offer advice on basic training, environmental management, product recommendations, and customized training plans to address specific training goals.

**Your Petco Career:**


All candidates are required to complete the ‘Dog Training Instructor Program’ to become Petco Certified Dog Trainer consisting of the following:

* Stage 1: Dog Training Apprentice: 6-weeks weeks of instructor led learning and development.
* Stage 2: Dog Trainer: Successfully run and grow the dog training business in one of Petco’s Pet Care Centers with local and national marketing support, with access to internal partner resources, networking, client acquisition through our state-of-the-art online booking and scheduling systems.
* *Note: Approved candidates with prior experience that can pass both skill and knowledge assessments may be eligible for accelerated training*

**Benefits:**

* Competitive base pay, plus incentive
* Medical, dental, vision and more
* 401k and more
* Paid time off
* Petco Discounts
* Career development and growth opportunities, such as a Dog Trainer Mentor, Dog Training Pro & Virtual Instructor

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct dog training group classes and private lessons with pet parents, educating them on positive reinforcement techniques and environmental management while providing guidance to strengthen the human-animal bond.
* Recommend and sell appropriate training tools, equipment, and supplies to pet parents, ensuring they have the necessary resources for successful training.
* Keep accurate records of training sessions, progress, and pet parents' feedback
* Maintain confidentiality and professionalism at all times.
* Collaborate with the store team to promote dog training services, assist with scheduling, and handle customer inquiries or concerns.
* Work cross functionally with grooming and veterinary teams to provide 360° solutions for all dog training guests.
* Ensure a safe and clean training environment by adhering to Petco's policies and procedures regarding animal care, health, and safety.
* Complete cash register transactions, guest buy-online-pick-up orders and other Pet Care Center merchandising activities, as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* Passion for animal care, training, and welfare and a genuine interest for improving the lives of pets and their pet parents.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with pet parents and provide clear instructions and demonstrations.
* Demonstrated ability to handle and work with dogs of all sizes, ages, and breeds in a safe and humane manner.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize responsibilities effectively.
* Flexibility to work weekends, evenings, and holidays as needed to accommodate the training schedule and store operations.
* Physical stamina to stand, walk, bend, and lift heavy objects (up to 50 pounds) associated with dog training equipment and supplies.
* Familiarity with computer systems and software to manage training records, schedules, and communication with pet parents.


Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the requirements and responsibilities of the Petco Dog Trainer position. Duties and qualifications may vary based on location and specific store needs.


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

title: Retail Sales - SKIMS - The Mall at Short Hills
description:
### **Job Description**


The ideal SKIMS Salesperson is passionate about fashion and styling and has the ability to cultivate and grow a customer following, both digitally and in-store.

 **A day in the life…**

* Achieve monthly/quarterly/yearly sales targets as aligned on by Nordstrom and SKIMS teams
* Provide your brand partner feedback around the customer and overall product needs that can’t be seen in reporting.
* Share images of SKIMS floor with brand contact weekly.
* Support organization and execution of SKIMS visual standards
* Ensure shapewear boxes, panty consoles, racks & nesting tables are full and neat at all times
* Ensure fixtures are cleaned, filled in and maintained throughout the day
* Maintain communication of needs with back stock and visual merchandising team
* Attend SKIMS brand and product training sessions
* Provide highest level of service and knowledge of product to all customers
* TRAINING: Take learnings from SKIMS brand partners and educate store peers at least 1x per month
* Set and achieve sales goals, for both in-store and digital selling with effective use of selling tools (inclusive of text and social media)
* Build lasting relationships with customers
* Give the best service to our customers on their terms
* Provide honest and confident feedback to customers about style and fit
* Seek fashion and product knowledge to build your expertise
* Work with the team to keep the department customer ready, which means filling orders, stocking, re-merchandising, price markdowns, and light cleaning
* Grow relationships by opening new Nordstrom Rewards program accounts
* The hours and schedule for this position will vary by week depending on business needs
* This role may require you to be flexible to occasionally performing work/duties in a department other than the one you were hired into
 **You own this if you have…**

* Excellent communication and people skills
* A self-motivated, goal oriented focus
* Strong interest to use networking and technology to achieve sales goals
* The ability to excel in a team environment
* The ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
* Organization and follow through
* The ability to work a flexible schedule based on business needs
**We’ve got you covered…**


Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:

* Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
* Life Insurance and Disability
* Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources


A few more important points...


The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.


Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.


Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.


© 2022 Nordstrom, Inc


Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.

title: Investigator
description:
**Job Description**

New York based Investigations and Background Screening Company is seeking qualified individuals for per diem surveillance and field investigation positions. The ideal candidate must have a strong work ethic, be self-motivated, have good problem solving skills and be team oriented. Candidate must be able to work independently, have strong time management skills, flexibility to travel and must have strong communication skills. Flexible hours are a must, to include: weekday, weekend, and evening hours. Interested candidates **must** have the following:

* **Documented surveillance and investigations experience.**
* A reliable vehicle.
* A valid US Driver's License is required - must be willing and able to drive.
* A cell phone; to be in contact with a case manager while on surveillance.
* A digital video camera, with date and time stamp capability.
* Be proficient using Word and ability to write detailed reports.
* Ability and willingness to travel as necessary within a multi-state location.

Individuals must present SPECIFIC evidence demonstrating they meet the above qualifications. Individuals will be expected to conduct interviews, take written statements, collect & analyze documentary evidence, prepare detailed written reports, and possibly testify in court or at formal hearings.

In return for your experience, we provide:

* Excellent pay
* Flexible schedules
* Reimbursement for mileage
* Payment for travel time at half the investigative rate

Please submit your resume containing all relevant experience.

Job Type: Full-Time

Salary: $28 to $28.50 /hour based on Law Enforcement/Surveillance experience

title: Visual Designer
description:
**Overview:**  
Takara Belmont USA is on the hunt for a dynamic **Visual Designer** who lives and breathes graphic design and digital marketing. If you're a creative powerhouse with a knack for crafting captivating content and a passion for shaping remarkable brands across print and digital landscapes, we want you on our team.

In this role, you will spearhead graphic design initiatives, meticulously curate visual identities, and actively create compelling marketing assets while ensuring alignment with our branding objectives. From ideation to execution, you will collaborate with internal teams and external partners to maintain a consistent brand image across all platforms, leaving a lasting impact on our audience. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy diving into diverse creative projects, and revel in turning complex challenges into elegant design solutions, this role is tailor-made for you. Join us and let your creativity take center stage in shaping the future of our brand.

**Responsibilities:**  
1. Craft purposeful, captivating, and strategically aligned graphic designs and visual content for both print and digital mediums across all divisions, ensuring strict adherence to brand guidelines.

2. Uphold the integrity of brand identity by meticulously maintaining brand standards across all creative executions and serving as the guardian of brand guidelines.

3. Harness the power of Adobe CC and AI software to design visually stunning layouts, images, videos, and animations, elevating the impact of marketing endeavors and brand narrative initiatives.

4. Offer a fresh perspective and strategic insight to effectively engage and influence the target audience, actively contributing innovative ideas and solutions during collaborative brainstorming sessions.

5. Conceptualize, design, and execute content for marketing campaigns, including social media posts, infographics, product videos, and other visual assets.

6. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver a diverse spectrum of design assets, spanning from advertisements and catalogs to social media campaigns and web graphics.

7. Contribute to project team success with on-time completion of tasks and ensuring seamless communication of task and updates across the team.

8. Innovate and craft compelling promotional content, including dynamic short-form videos, tailored for dissemination across multiple social media platforms and websites, optimizing graphics and video elements for maximum impact.

9. Take the lead on photo and video projects from concept to delivery, overseeing storyboard creation, design, capture, and post-production processes.

10. Design visually striking graphics, illustrations, and creative assets tailored for web, social media, and digital platforms, simplifying the communication of complex concepts through engaging infographics and presentation materials.

11. Coordinate with internal stakeholders and external vendors to ensure seamless production, editing, and deployment of video and photo content, providing invaluable support to print and digital advertising initiatives.

12. Oversee and organize a library of print and digital assets, facilitating requests from internal teams, strategic partners, and customers, and maintaining the print literature library to streamline the creation, production, and fulfillment process.

13. Maintain and continually improve the organization's websites, ensuring they are up-to-date, user-friendly, and aligned with brand standards across all divisions. This includes updating content, images, and other multimedia elements as needed, performing regular audits for functionality and responsiveness, and implementing necessary improvements to enhance the overall user experience.

14. Interface with various departments to gather valuable input and ensure alignment with campaign objectives and messaging, offering insights and recommendations to enhance communication strategies.

15. Create compelling multi-media content, including video testimonials, KOL interviews, product demonstrations, and walkthroughs, to amplify brand presence across print and digital platforms, supporting branding campaigns, product profiles, and announcements.

16. Develop and coordinate comprehensive trade show marketing materials, ranging from product literature and promotional flyers to banners and sales peripherals, enhancing brand visibility and fostering engagement at industry events.

17. All other duties as assigned by management.

**Qualifications:**  
Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, advertising art, or related field, or equivalent professional experience

At least 1-2 years of graphic design experience. Relevant job experience in lieu of degree will be considered.

1-2 years of branding, marketing, advertising, public relations or communications experience preferred

**Please submit your design portfolio when applying for this position.**

**Required:**

Graphic Design (Advanced); Visual Communications (Advanced); Branding & Visual Identity (Basic); Core Design Principles (Advanced); Layout & Typography (Basic); Ideation & Storyboarding (Basic); Digital Catalog Design; Microsoft Office 365; Adobe Creative Suite (Advanced); Adobe Premiere (Basic); WordPress (Basic); HTML & CSS (Basic); Collaboration & Creativity; Organization & Time Management

**Preferred:**

Product Photography (Basic); Product Videography (Basic); Frontend Web Design (Basic); Social Media Content (Basic); Print & Digital Advertising (Basic); Presentation & Template Design; Exhibition Display & Signage; Responsive E-mail Design; Brand Design & Storytelling; Website Management (Advanced); UI/UX Design Elements (Advanced); Motion Design (Basic); Vendor Coordination; AI Design & Efficiency Tools

**Desired:**

SEO/SEM & PPC Advertising; Branding & Creative Strategy; B2B Marketing (Advanced); CPQ Assets & Systems (Basic); Digital Asset Management Systems; Salesforce & CRM Platforms (Basic); Print Production (Advanced); Brand Photography (Advanced); Brand Videography (Advanced); Video Editing & Production (Advanced); WordPress, HTML, CSS (Advanced); E-commerce Platforms (Basic)

title: Cyber Security Analyst
description:
**Primary Purpose:**

The Cyber Security Analyst (Level 1) conducts vulnerability scans, threat hunting, documentation, and mitigation support to the entire Schuman Cheese Company. This individual will work closely with our co-managed vendors to ensure the corporate network's security. The Cyber Security Level 1 Analyst will be at our Fairfield, NJ office five days a week (Monday – Friday). This individual will coordinate with other IT staff to deliver prompt and practical solutions. The Cyber Security Analyst (Level 1) will maintain and update the management team on potential issues.

**Responsibilities:**

* Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and best practices and maintain situational awareness of cyber activity by reviewing new vulnerabilities, malware, or other threats that could impact the organization.
* Knowledge and understanding of Cyber Security Frameworks such as MITRE, NIST, etc.
* Configuration and monitor systems and endpoints for security incidents.
* Coordinate resources during enterprise incident response efforts, driving incidents to timely and complete resolution.
* Recommend remediation and recovery strategies and suggest defensive policy enhancements and information technology procedures.
* Deliver status reports, briefings, recommendations, and findings to management and executives as required.
* Use various tools to investigate incidents and take immediate action or recommend a course of action to safeguard the Schuman network.
* Monitor and respond to security-related alerts triggered in the SIEM.
* Work with Help Desk during overflow situations.
* Be available for emergency after-hours security issues.
* Other duties may be assigned from time to time by the manager

**Education, Qualities and Skills Required:**

* 1+ years of experience handling security events related to viruses/malware, detection and analysis, email security, endpoint detection, and response.
* 2+ years of experience in information technology, working with operating systems, mobile devices, etc.
* Strong communication skills, both written and oral.
* Organized, responsive, and comprehensive problem solver.

**Supervisory Responsibility:**

This position has no direct report responsibility.

**Work Environment:**

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:**

This is a full-time salaried position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday. Expectations of 45 hours per week, to be worked during normal business hours. This position is full time on-site.

**Physical Requirements:**

The physical requirements of this position are similar to those found in an office position and include standing/sitting for extended periods of time, operating traditional office equipment, i.e., computer, printer, etc, and the ability to safely walk to, from and around the warehouse on even walking surfaces. This role will be often exposed to temperatures between 33-50 degrees Fahrenheit.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the work and may not include all the duties required of the position.

Recruiters: Please do not send unsolicited resumes. Schuman Cheese is not responsible for fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Thank you.

title: Day Hab Instructor - Full Time
description:
**DAY HAB INSTRUCTOR** 

The Day Hab Instructor is to ensure the best possible emotional, physical, social well-being of our consumers. Each of our programs is individualized to meet the needs and interests of the consumers who reside at C.L.C.

**Essential Functions:**

· Consumers requiring transportation must be picked up and brought to the Day Hab office.

· While at the office (AM) assist with coffee preparation, facilitate conversations and monitor consumers at all times.

· Provide “Active Treatment.” “Active treatment” is defined as the application of therapeutic strategies taught in PBS and clinical trainings under the guidelines of the Behavioral Mental Health Model. Utilize philosophy of the therapeutic model and apply this knowledge to daily work.

· Staff is responsible for providing the following medical services to consumers. Again, there may be other responsibilities assigned by the RM, PA, RN, or other supervisor as needed:

o Administration of medication if necessary

o Observing and reporting physical conditions and behaviors daily.

o Recording physical and behavioral events and/or changes and reporting promptly to Health Services daily.

o Awareness of how to activate the emergency medical and administrative systems.

o Knowledge of OSHA standards and regulations.

o Administration of First Aid and CPR as required

o Attending to medical needs, including: monitoring blood pressure, blood sugar levels, and other physical symptoms such as sleep and bowel habits, applying first aid, and administering medication and monitoring of medication side effects daily.

· Monitor consumers personal hygiene and clothing (ensuring work/weather appropriate clothing is worn)

· ALL consumers must be accompanied by Day Hab staff to and from vehicles.

· Daily inspections of vehicles: prior to leaving and immediately upon return at end of day.

· Maintain vehicle log book.

· Maintain a clean vehicle (1x weekly or as needed)

· Take vehicle in for scheduled services, and report any problems/concerns with vehicles as needed.

· Transport consumers to and from work sites.

· While at work sites the Day Hab Instructor is expected to:

o Supervise all consumers in group

o Assist consumers requiring additional help

o Provide instruction on proper work techniques

o Set positive example by working alongside consumers

o Provide positive reinforcement as needed

o Maintain daily job coach log book; describing the day’s activities, location and consumers present.

o Report any problems/concerns to Day Hab Director upon return to office.

· Consumers requiring transportation must be dropped off at end of work day.

· All Day Hab vehicles and keys must be returned at end of day.

· Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with all staff members including Administration, Accounting, Residential, Health Services, Human Resources, Purchasing, Maintenance and Day Hab.

· Applicant will provide mentoring and teaching services to individuals with developmental disabilities.

· Provide a fun and educational atmosphere for individuals

· Train in and demonstrate competency of CPR, SCIP, Person-Centered Planning, Defensive Driving, Positive Behavioral Strategies.

· Ability to work independently

· Responsible for supervising a group of Day Habilitation participants as they engage in activities on and off site.

· Ensure the group’s weekly activity is adhered to, and that participants exhibit appropriate social behavior during participation in the program.

**Must possess a HS Diploma/GED, valid driver's license for a minimum of 3 years, and own transportation.** Background check and drug testing required.

*\\*****Signing Bonus up to $1000.00*** *(\\*Full Time Employees - $500.00 upon hire and $500.00 upon completion of a probationary period and required trainings.)*

*\\*****Full-Time Employee Health Insurance Paid in Full***'

In addition, CLC will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.
